_kernel_oserror * register_usb_device (unsigned int usb_device_number, unsigned int idVendor, unsigned int idProduct, char *pendant_extension, char *own_config_extension)

Detailed Description

Contains data structures and definitions used by the FTDI driver for DeviceFS under RISC OS.

Define Documentation

#define FTDI_MAX_NUMBER_CALLBACK_REQUESTS   64
 

#define FTDI_NO_BUFFER_HANDLE   0
 

#define FTDI_NO_DEVICEFS_HANDLE   0
 

#define FTDI_NO_FILE_HANDLE   0
 

#define FTDI_VALIDATION   "baud/ndata/nstop/nnoparity,even,odd/snohandshake,rts,dtr,xon/ssize/nthres/n"
 

Sequence of switches must match IOCTL and should be similar to usual RISC OS serial port validation.

Function Documentation

_kernel_oserror* register_usb_device (  unsigned int  usb_device_number,
unsigned int  idVendor,
unsigned int  idProduct,
char *  pendant_extension,
char *  own_config_extension
) 
 

Will setup the USB side of the driver and configure a given usb device. At the end it will set up the DeviceFS side of the device by calling register_device as far as possible.

You must pass vendor and product ID to determine configuration. You may pass pendant and own config extension.
